alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 07 at 8:23PM EDT until April 08 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of eastern New York, including the following areas, Eastern Greene, Eastern Ulster, Western Albany, Western Schenectady, Hamilton, Montgomery, Fulton and Southern Herkimer counties * WHEN...Until 5 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches with the higher amounts in the southern Adirondacks and central Mohawk Valley - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
